reviewText: A brilliant notion to interview some of America's songwriters before they shuffled off their mortal coils. Filmed in the start of the 1980s, this is a great record of the guys who brought wit and literacy to the craft of song-writing, something extinct in the music of today. My personal highlights are the Alan Jay Lerner and Yip Harburg segments, which demonstrate the hard graft and sensitivity of talented song-writing. A glorious dvd set! They're Playing Our Song: Conversations With America's Classic Songwriters Notes on Broadway: Intimate Conversations With Broadway's Greatest Songwriters

What a treat!  To hear the stories behind the songs we love - it's really fun to get the inside story about these wonderful tunes directly from those who composed the songs and/or lyrics.  Many of these talented individuals performed the songs themselves.

It would be fun to know when and where these programs originally aired.  If there are more of these shows out there I hope they are brought to DVD...again, what a great collection of DVDs...anyone who loves musicals will surely enjoy these!
